name: usurpation
content:

the act of taking control of something without having the right to, especially of a position of power: his unlawful usurpation of power There are still those who regard the move as an unconstitutional usurpation of private property. See
usurp
More examplesFewer examplesShe accused him of a usurpation and abuse of power.He spent nearly all his life fighting against oppression and usurpation.Human Rights organizations have persistently exposed the blatant usurpation of our rights and privileges.
